Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: watson
Description: A wonderful CLI to track your time

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show help for watson

Arguments.Name: --version
Arguments.Description: Show the version for watson

Arguments.Name: --color
Arguments.Description: Color output

Arguments.Name: --no-color
Arguments.Description: No color output

Arguments.Name: add
Arguments.Description: Add time to a project with tag(s) that was not tracked live

Arguments.Name: --from
Arguments.Description: Date and time of start of tracked activity

Arguments.Name: DATETIME
Arguments.Description: DATETIME

Arguments.Name: --to
Arguments.Description: Date and time of end of tracked activity

Arguments.Name: DATETIME
Arguments.Description: DATETIME

Arguments.Name: --confirm-new-project
Arguments.Description: Confirm creation of new tag

Arguments.Name: aggregate
Arguments.Description: Display a report of the time spent on each project aggregated by day

Arguments.Name: --current
Arguments.Description: Include currently running frame in report

Arguments.Name: --no-current
Arguments.Description: Don't include currently running frame in report

Arguments.Name: --from
Arguments.Description: The date from when the reports should start. Defaults to seven days ago

Arguments.Name: DATETIME
Arguments.Description: DATETIME

Arguments.Name: --to
Arguments.Description: The date at which the report should stop (inclusive). Defaults to tomorrow

Arguments.Name: DATETIME
Arguments.Description: DATETIME

Arguments.Name: --project
Arguments.Description: Reports activity only for the given project. You can add other projects by using this option several times

Arguments.Name: PROJECT
Arguments.Description: PROJECT

Arguments.Name: --tag
Arguments.Description: Reports activity only for frames containing the given tag. You can add several tags by using this option multiple times

Arguments.Name: TAG
Arguments.Description: TAG

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Format output in JSON instead of plain text

Arguments.Name: --csv
Arguments.Description: Format output in CSV instead of plain text

Arguments.Name: --pager
Arguments.Description: View output through a pager

Arguments.Name: --no-pager
Arguments.Description: Don't view output through a pager

Arguments.Name: cancel
Arguments.Description: Cancel the last call to the start command. The time will not be recorded

Arguments.Name: config
Arguments.Description: Get and set configuration options

Arguments.Name: --edit
Arguments.Description: Edit the configuration file with an editor

Arguments.Name: SECTION.OPTION
Arguments.Description: SECTION.OPTION

Arguments.Name: backend.url
Arguments.Description: This is the API root url of your repository, e.g. https://my.server.com/api/

Arguments.Name: backend.token
Arguments.Description: To authenticate watson as an API client, once generated, you will need to set up your API token in your configuration, e.g. 7e329263e329

Arguments.Name: options.confirm_new_project
Arguments.Description: If true, the user will be asked for confirmation before creating a new project. The option can be overriden in the command line with --confirm-new-project flag. Default: false

Arguments.Name: options.confirm_new_tag
Arguments.Description: If true, the user will be asked for confirmation before creating a new tag. The option can be overriden in the command line with --confirm-new-tag flag. Default: false

Arguments.Name: options.date_format
Arguments.Description: Globally configure how dates should be formatted. All python’s strftime directives are supported. Default: %Y.%m.%d

Arguments.Name: options.log_current
Arguments.Description: If true, the output of the log command will include the currently running frame (if any) by default. The option can be overridden on the command line with the -c/-C resp. --current/--no-current flags. Default: false

Arguments.Name: options.pager
Arguments.Description: If true, the output of the log and report command will be run through a pager by default. The option can be overridden on the command line with the -g/-G or --pager/--no-pager flags. If other commands output in colour, but log or report do not, try disabling the pager. Default: true

Arguments.Name: options.report_current
Arguments.Description: If true, the output of the report command will include the currently running frame (if any) by default. The option can be overridden on the command line with the -c/-C resp. --current/--no-current flags. Default: false

Arguments.Name: options.reverse_log
Arguments.Description: If true, the output of the log command will reverse the order of the days to display the latest day’s entries on top and the oldest day’s entries at the bottom. The option can be overridden on the command line with the -r/-R resp. --reverse/--no-reverse flags. Default: true

Arguments.Name: options.stop_on_start
Arguments.Description: If true, starting a new project will stop running projects. Default false

Arguments.Name: options.stop_on_restart
Arguments.Description: Similar to the options.stop_on_start option, but for the restart command. Default: false

Arguments.Name: options.time_format
Arguments.Description: Globally configure how time should be formatted. All python’s strftime directives are supported. Default: %H.%M:%S%z

Arguments.Name: options.week_start
Arguments.Description: Globally configure which day corresponds to the start of a week. Allowable values are monday, tuesday, wednesday, thursday, friday, saturday, and sunday

Arguments.Name: VALUE
Arguments.Description: VALUE

Arguments.Name: merge
Arguments.Description: Perform a merge of the existing frames with a conflicting frames file.  When storing the frames on a file hosting service, there is the possibility that the frame file goes out-of-sync due to one or more of the connected clients going offline. This can cause the frames to diverge

Arguments.Name: -f
Arguments.Description: If specified, then the merge will automatically be performed

Arguments.Name: FRAMES_WITH_CONFLICT
Arguments.Description: FRAMES_WITH_CONFLICT

Arguments.Name: projects
Arguments.Description: Display the list of all the existing projects

Arguments.Name: remove
Arguments.Description: Remove a frame. You can specify the frame either by id or by position (ex: -1 for the last frame)

Arguments.Name: -f
Arguments.Description: Don’t ask for confirmation
